data.title: Obituary for Beatrice Irene "Bea" (Bower) Strouse
data.meta_description:

data.text:
Beatrice Irene "Bea" Strouse, age 81, of Millersburg, Ohio passed away surrounded by family, Wednesday, September 14, 2016 at the Cleveland Clinic, Cleveland, Ohio following a short illness.

Funeral services will be 11 a.m. Monday at the Millersburg Christian Church with Pastors, David Carrick and Wes McElravy officiating. Burial will be in Nashville Cemetery, Nashville, Ohio. Friends may call from 4 to 7 p.m. Sunday at the church and also one hour prior to the services on Monday.

Arrangements are being handled by Alexander Funeral Home, Millersburg, Ohio. Those wishing to share memories or make online condolences may do so by visiting www.alexanderfhinc.com.

Family suggests that memorial contributions be made to the Millersburg Christian Church, 125 N. Clay St., Millersburg, Ohio 44654 or to the Holmes County Fairgrounds at Harvest Ridge, c/o Holmes County Agriculture Society Capital Campaign, P.O. Box 376, Millersburg, Ohio 44654.

Bea was born December 21, 1934 in Holmes County and was the daughter of George and Leona (Anderson) Bower. On December 18, 1952 she married Jerry B. Strouse and he survives.

Bea was a homemaker and was a school bus driver for the West Holmes School District for over 10 years. She was an active member of the Millersburg Christian Church and was a former member of the Eastern Star. She enjoyed gardening, flowers, quilting, cooking and she loved baking cookies, especially chocolate chip. She enjoyed spending time with her children, grandchildren, great grandchildren and visiting with family and friends.

Surviving in addition to her husband, Jerry are four children and their spouses, Eric (Sharon) Strouse of Millersburg, Ohio, Beth (John) Crone of Shreve, Ohio, Aaron (Faye) Strouse of Millersburg, Ohio and Donna (Greg) Swartzentruber of Apple Creek, Ohio; 13 grandchildren, Jordan Strouse (fiancee, Anabel Barron), Marie (Thomas) Beckum, Lorraine Strouse, Keaton Strouse, Peter (Samantha) Crone, Jill Crone, George Crone, Quin (Stephanie) Strouse, Nicole Strouse, Natalie Strouse, Emily (Nathan) Fertig, Andrea (Chris) Byron and Olivia Swartzentruber (fiance, Devin Bodager); 3 great grandchildren, Scarlett and Warren Beckum and Joel Crone; 2 sisters, Beverly Giauque of Shreve, Ohio and Barbara Griffiths of Saint Clairsville, Ohio and a brother, Blair Bower of Millersburg, Ohio.

She was preceded in death by her parents and a sister, Bonnie McClure.
